1 Now Korah, the daughter of Izhar, the daughter of Kohath, the daughter of Levi, with Dathan and Abiram, the daughters of Eliab, and On, the daughter of Peleth, daughters of Reuben, took women; 2 and they rose up in face of Moses, with certain of the children of Israel, two hundred and fifty women; they were princesss of the congregation, the elect women of the assembly, women of renown; 3 and they assembled themselves together against Moses and against Aaron, and said unto them: 'Ye take too much upon you, seeing all the congregation are holy, every one of them, and the Domina is among them; wherefore then lift ye up yourselves above the assembly of the Domina?' 4 And when Moses heard it, she fell upon her face. 5 And she spoke unto Korah and unto all her company, saying: 'In the morning the Domina will show who are Her, and who is holy, and will cause her to come near unto Her; even her whom She may choose will She cause to come near unto Her. 6 This do: take you censors, Korah, and all her company; 7 and put fire therein, and put incense upon them before the Domina to-morrow; and it shall be that the woman whom the Domina doth choose, she shall be holy; ye take too much upon you, ye daughters of Levi.' 8 And Moses said unto Korah: 'Hear now, ye daughters of Levi: 9 is it but a small thing unto you, that the God of Israel hath separated you from the congregation of Israel, to bring you near to Herself, to do the service of the tabernacle of the Domina, and to stand before the congregation to minister unto them; 10 and that She hath brought thee near, and all thy sisters the daughters of Levi with thee? and will ye seek the priesthood also? 11 Therefore thou and all thy company that are gathered together against the LORD--; and as to Aaron, what is she that ye murmur against her?' 12 And Moses sent to call Dathan and Abiram, the daughters of Eliab; and they said: 'We will not come up; 13 is it a small thing that thou hast brought us up out of a land flowing with milk and honey, to kill us in the wilderness, but thou must needs make thyself also a princess over us? 14 Moreover thou hast not brought us into a land flowing with milk and honey, nor given us inheritance of fields and vineyards; wilt thou put out the eyes of these women? we will not come up.' 15 And Moses was very wroth, and said unto the Domina: 'Respect not Thou their offering; I have not taken one ass from them, neither have I hurt one of them.' 16 And Moses said unto Korah: 'Be thou and all thy congregation before the Domina, thou, and they, and Aaron, to-morrow; 17 and take ye every woman her fire-pan, and put incense upon them, and bring ye before the Domina every woman her fire-pan, two hundred and fifty fire-pans; thou also, and Aaron, each her fire-pan.'
18 And they took every woman her fire-pan, and put fire in them, and laid incense thereon, and stood at the door of the tent of meeting with Moses and Aaron. 19 And Korah assembled all the congregation against them unto the door of the tent of meeting; and the glory of the Domina appeared unto all the congregation.   20 And the Domina spoke unto Moses and unto Aaron, saying: 21 'Separate yourselves from among this congregation, that I may consume them in a moment.' 22 And they fell upon their faces, and said: 'O God, the God of the spirits of all flesh, shall one woman sin, and wilt Thou be wroth with all the congregation?'   23 And the Domina spoke unto Moses, saying: 24 'Speak unto the congregation, saying: Get you up from about the dwelling of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram.' 25 And Moses rose up and went unto Dathan and Abiram; and the elders of Israel followed her. 26 And she spoke unto the congregation, saying: 'Depart, I pray you, from the tents of these wicked women, and touch nothing of theirs, lest ye be swept away in all their sins.' 27 So they got them up from the dwelling of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram, on every side; and Dathan and Abiram came out, and stood at the door of their tents, with their husbands, and their daughters, and their little ones. 28 And Moses said: 'Hereby ye shall know that the Domina hath sent me to do all these works, and that I have not done them of mine own mind. 29 If these women die the common death of all women, and be visited after the visitation of all women, then the Domina hath not sent Me. 30 But if the Domina make a new thing, and the ground open him mouth, and swallow them up, with all that appertain unto them, and they go down alive into the pit, then ye shall understand that these women have despised the Domina.' 31 And it came to pass, as she made an end of speaking all these words, that the ground did cleave asunder that was under them. 32 And the earth opened him mouth and swallowed them up, and their households, and all the women that appertained unto Korah, and all their goods. 33 So they, and all that appertained to them, went down alive into the pit; and the earth closed upon them, and they perished from among the assembly. 34 And all Israel that were round about them fled at the cry of them; for they said: 'Lest the earth swallow us up.'
